justification: The Methods note that participants’ "individual self-esteem score (Rosenberg score)" was used for grouping and analyses, and the reference list explicitly lists the "Rosenberg self-esteem scale (RSE)."

The article explains that "At the end of each block, participants were asked to select the task on which they thought they had performed best (Task choice)…The two end-of-block measures…provided proxies for self-performance estimates."

Participants "additionally provided a subjective rating of self-performance on each of the two tasks on a continuous scale (Task ratings)…The two end-of-block measures, namely task choice and task ratings, provided proxies for self-performance estimates."
